channel.title: The Idea of a Cache Editor Add-on
channel.description:
Well, for a while now, I've been thinking of an idea for a cache editor that would require only half the work of a normal editor. I noticed that Zymus had the same idea, and I wanted to just throw it out online to see what other people thought of it. Basically, it's an editor that is added onto a client. This would prevent the need to unpack things, and the game engines, like interface and map drawing, etc... would already be there ready to use. The online part of the client would be removed, and the user would be able to just select their cache on start-up and it would be edited from there.
However, after all of the research for repacking, the knowledge for unpacking it would be acquired, and the project would really be only good for learning. I guess the only benefit of making a cache editor like this is everything's already there.
Your opinions?
~Lin

item.title: The Idea of a Cache Editor Add-on
item.dc:creator: @Darthax Darthax
item.description:
@Darthax wrote:

yea once you have all working you could do the big step and make it load 500+ clients now that would be insane.

item.title: The Idea of a Cache Editor Add-on
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

GalkonsPride:

I’ve sort of had this idea too. I’ve been working on an in-game cache editing function. I mean, the 317 client already reads the cache, loads the data, and uses it. Just manipulate it to display it, and edit it.

long time, no see.

Please post the progress on this website.

Read full topic

I fail to see the point of this.
[/quote]
???
The point is quite clear; to add more content correctly.[/quote]

Ohh, i understand.

He is basically adding a tool, that makes it where you don’t have to hard code everything in the cache.

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Basically, interactive ANYTHING editor

Right click options on a tile, add item, npc, object, etc
change tile height, color, texture, add door, orientation, anything

IN THE CACHE
